channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Norway and Denmark ban tourists from lockdown-free Sweden from entering the country
item.description: Norway and Denmark said they will not open up to Sweden due to its high coronavirus infection rate. This is despite Swedish ministers asking the countries to act in Nordic co-operation.

item.title: Weekend lockdown breakers WILL be fined, police warn as UK braces for mass rule breaking
item.description: Police chiefs and MPs have complained that the Government is putting them into an impossible situation by announcing the changes before a sunny weekend.

item.title: White House goes into lockdown amid countrywide demonstrations over the death of George Floyd
item.description: The White House has gone into lockdown as protesters tried to scale the walls, battled with Secret Service and burned American flags in outrage of the death of George Floyd.

item.title: Newly-elected Tory MP sent 'abusive messages' for taking maternity leave
item.description: Siobhan Baillie - elected MP for Stroud in Gloucestershire last year - gave birth to a baby girl last week and announced she was taking four weeks of maternity leave, leading to abusive messages.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Border officials say quarantine unenforceable
item.description: Plans to quarantine travellers coming into Britain were falling apart last night as they came under fire from all sides. Border Force and police officials say the system is 'unenforceable'.

item.title: Rishi Sunak races to build 100bn job creation scheme amid fears 2MILLION will lose their jobs
item.description: During the Downing St press conference the Chancellor promised to address the looming employment crisis with a scheme to create additional jobs.

item.title: On Her Majesty's Sandwich Service
item.description: Scones, sandwiches, sunshine and a chance to chat to her subjects, it's no wonder the Queen loves hosting her annual summer garden parties.

item.title: John Lennon's last photo sighting, seen with his killer: Enhanced images give insight into murder
item.description: It is 4pm on December 8, 1980 in New York. As John Lennon leaves his home on Central Park West, he pauses to autograph a record for Mark David Chapman, without a suspicion in the world.

item.title: Coronavirus: Three more councils won't reopen schools on 1 June
item.description: Nine out of 10 headteachers in England plan to open their schools on 1 June despite fierce opposition from teaching unions, a survey of 2000 heads has found.

item.title: Derek Chauvin taken into custody after George Floyd death
item.description: Fired police officer Derek Chauvin has been arrested four days after he was filmed kneeling on the neck of black man George Floyd during his arrest.

item.title: Desperate man lured into debt and tycoon behind it: GUY ADAMS exposes truth about gambling fat cat
item.description: Mor Weizer's firm Playtech was slammed in a report, which found 'systemic failings' in the way it managed social responsibilities. It failed to interact with Chris Bruney, who took his life in 2017.

item.title: Only half of Britons are self-isolating when they get coronavirus symptoms
item.description: SAGE's disclosure of the possibility of low compliance with a key rule in suppressing Covid-19 comes days before the lockdown is eased.

item.title: EDEN CONFIDENTIAL: Jonathan Aitken, 77, survives a heart attack induced by coronavirus
item.description: EDEN CONFIDENTIAL: Now, I can reveal, the former Cabinet minister has shrugged off his closest brush with death to date - a heart attack induced by the coronavirus.

item.title: MARKET REPORT: Investors look to bag property bargain
item.description: British Land climbed 2.5 per cent after Brookfield Asset Management snapped up a stake. Traders also welcomed the news that Capital & Counties is eyeing a stake in Shaftesbury.

item.title: Spain awaits and it won't Costa Lotta! We pick our favourite costas with deals of up to a third off
item.description: This week Spain gave the green light to tourism beginning in July. Optimistic that FCO advice warning against leisure travel will change, we look at the best deals for coastal hotspots.

item.title: Desperate motorist tries in vain to stop his car drifting out to sea in Whitstable
item.description: Whitstable local Lee Dolby, 40, filmed the man wading through the waves to rescue his Volkswagen Golf, which can be seen bobbing up and down in the water.

item.title: DR MICHAEL MOSLEY launches a health revolution with a diet that really could save your life
item.description: One way to minimise the chance of this happening and to ensure your immune system is working is by losing excess weight.

item.title: JOHN HUMPHRYS: End these degrees of greed
item.description: JOHN HUMPHRYS: What they so often deliver is debt and disappointment. Something has gone horribly wrong in the past couple of decades and it's time to put it right.

item.title: Wartime cover star known as the 'girl with the tractor', now aged 100, tells her extraordinary story
item.description: The 'girl with the tractor' is revealed as Patricia Fack, a former debutante who went on to marry a Dutch diplomat. For almost 80 years, few have known the identity of the Women's Land Army recruit.

item.title: SpaceX's fourth Starship rocket prototype EXPLODES into a ball of flames after a pressurized test
item.description: SpaceX's prototype Starship rocket, Serial Number 4, vanished into a fireball at SpaceX's Boca Chica site in Texas Friday shortly the engine was ignited for a pressurized test.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: How to have a socially distanced barbecue
item.description: With lockdown restrictions to ease from Monday, many people planning to have social gatherings or BBQs with up to six people must follow a very specific set of guidelines, as life edges towards normality.

item.title: Black people in England are 3.4 times more likely to test positive for Covid-19 than white people
item.description: Minority ethnic groups in England have a bigger risk of testing positive for Covid-19, according to a new study from researchers at the University of Glasgow.

item.title: CLIVE HAMILTON: China wants nothing less than a life-and-death battle with the West
item.description: By a majority of 2,878 to one (with six abstentions), The National People's Congress this week rubber-stamped a proposal that will change life for the citizens of Hong Kong for ever.

item.title: Robbie Williams REUNITES with Take That for virtual gig
item.description: Robbie Williams delighted fans as he reunited with Take That for a virtual performance from their homes on Friday night.

item.title: Sophie Ellis Bextor talks surviving lockdown with five sons and performing concerts from her kitchen
item.description: Every Friday night for ten weeks, Sophie Ellis-Bextor has donned her own glad rags and invited us all to a social media disco round at hers. The singer reveals all her survival tips for lockdown.

item.title: George Floyd death: Minneapolis under curfew amid protests
item.description: Minnesota Governor Tim Walz on Friday admitted an 'abject failure' by law enforcement in trying to control crowds of rioters who took over Minneapolis on Thursday night.

item.title: Married police superintendent is suspended after being accused of having an affair with a colleague
item.description: Superintendent Nick Lyall (pictured), who is suspended on full pay, is the most prominent face in Britain's battle with the illicit slaying of birds of prey.

item.title: NASA-SpaceX launch has just a 50 percent chance of liftoff for Saturday and could be moved to Sunday
item.description: NASA and SpaceX are gearing up for the second attempt at launching Falcon 9 Saturday There is only a 50 percent probability it will happen, but officials said it could be moved to Sunday.

item.title: Kylie Jenner could face criminal investigation over alleged exaggerations of her company's value
item.description: Kylie Jenner could face a criminal investigation over alleged exaggerations of her company's value, financial fraud attorney Jan Handzlik told DailyMail.com.

item.title: The most apocalyptic killer virus coming home to roost
item.description: This apocalyptic warning comes from Dr Michael Greger, a scientist, medical guru and campaigning nutritionist. His conclusion is that our close connection to animals makes us vulnerable.

item.title: Emily Lloyd enchanted us in Wish You Were Here - then suffered years of mental turmoil
item.description: Emily was 18 when she finally confessed to her family that she had suffered years of 'horrendous' abuse which started when she was five.

item.title: BBC receives 40,000 complaints in just two days after Emily Maitlis sparks impartiality row
item.description: Some viewers have been incensed at what they see as the BBC Two show's bias against Mr Cummings and the Government, while others have been enraged by the corporation's rapid climbdown.

item.title: Litter of 14 black and gold puppies is thought to be England's largest set of Labrador siblings yet
item.description: The arrival of so many pups was unexpected as their mother Bella, a six-year-old black labrador, has had three previous litters of between six and eight.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: 'No further action' over spitting passenger
item.description: Belly Mujinga died in April aged 47 of Covid-19, a few weeks after a passenger spat at her in London's Victoria Station. Detectives concluded the incident did not lead to her death, said British Transport Police.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Contract tracers say system is a 'shambles'
item.description: With great fanfare, Boris Johnson last week announced a 'world beating' army of contact tracers whose job is to stop coronavirus in its tracks.

item.title: Coronavirus 'R' rate could be as low as 0.5 outside of hospitals
item.description: The controversial 'R' rate of the coronavirus is closer to 0.5 in the community, newly released documents show. The R rate is the value the Government uses to base decisions on easing lockdown.

item.title: BEL MOONEY: Can I stop my nasty wife ruling every part of my life?
item.description: This week, Bel gives advice to a man who has a controlling wife who spends about £700 a month on clothes, shoes, hair, nails.

item.title: Coronavirus US: Trump 'terminates relationship' with WHO
item.description: President Donald Trump announced on Friday that the United States was terminating its relationship with the World Health Organization as he laid down the gauntlet against China.

item.title: Simon Thomas reveals his father has died at the age of 78
item.description: The former Sky presenter, 47, took to Instagram on Friday to inform fans of the tragic news.

item.title: Durham chief constable faces probe into her handling of investigation into Dominic Cummings' trip
item.description: Durham Police received complaints over the handling of the investigation into Dominic Cummings. A portion are understood to have been made against Chief Constable Jo Farrell.

item.title: Man dies after 'rock-throwing incident' in grounds of Kent castle
item.description: Charles Hilder, 66, from Romford, Essex, died in the grounds of Lullingstone Castle in Eynsford, Kent, following the attack at 5pm yesterday by the yobs who were stood on a bank.

item.title: George Floyd death: Obama speaks out as Derek Chauvin arrested
item.description: Barack Obama has called for justice to be done, and called for an end to racial inequality - which remains 'tragically, painfully and maddeningly "normal"' for millions of Americans.'

item.title: George Floyd and Derek Chauvin knew each other from work
item.description: Maya Santamaria (top right) says now-fired Minneapolis police officer Derek Chauvin (left) and George Floyd worked security at her club, El Nuevo Rodeo (bottom right) up until late last year.

item.title: George Floyd death: Joe Biden slams Trump over tweets
item.description: Joe Biden on Friday slammed President Donald Trump for his handling of George Floyd's death after the black man died while in custody of white police officers.

item.title: Police have issued 841 fines since lockdown was eased
item.description: There were 1,019 fixed penalty notices (FPNs) issued in England between May 12 and 25 - roughly one fifth of the 4,967 handed out during the previous fortnight, provisional data shows.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Experts told SAGE not to lift lockdown too soon
item.description: A trove of scientific papers sent to the Government in April and May has revealed stark warnings about lifting lockdown and said reopening pubs and restaurants could spell disaster.

item.title: Twitter flags Trump's tweet AGAIN after White House account reposts it
item.description: President Trump lashed out at Twitter Friday morning for covering up his tweet with a warning label that said it was 'glorifying violence.'

item.title: Desperate vineyard owners fly in Romanian pickers by PRIVATE JET to save their harvest in Italy
item.description: Vineyards across Italy rely on foreign fruit pickers from Eastern Europe and Africa in the summer, but the coronavirus crisis has meant few have been able to travel to the country for the work.

item.title: MP insists social distancing was in place at veteran´s...
item.description: Kevan Jones, 56, who represents North Durham, said only a small number of people attended Frederick Herron's party in Quaking Houses village on May 10 during lockdown.

item.title: Spanish flight is quarantined after passenger gets positive coronavirus test result in the air
item.description: The plane, which arrived in Lanzarote in the Canary Islands from Madrid this afternoon, was immediately zoned off by health and security officials at Cesar Manrique airport.

item.title: Coronavirus England: Hot weather to test weekend lockdown
item.description: Number 10 insisted England must wait until Monday before lockdown rules are eased, allowing groups of six people to meet up outdoors, despite the prospect of a sunny weekend.

item.title: Cambridge developers build parking space-sized 'micro-homes'
item.description: Developers have brushed off criticism over their 182-square foot apartments and insist the micro-homes in Cambridge are 'a perfectly reasonable size'.

item.title: World's oldest man, 111, says love is the secret to a long life
item.description: Dumitru Comanescu, a grandfather from Romania has been awarded the title of the oldest man in the world, at 111 years and 203 days old.

item.title: Harry Redknapp blasted for flouting social-distancing rules while having glass of wine with a friend
item.description: Harry Redknapp, 73, was pictured sipping a glass of wine outside a pub on the Sandbanks peninsula over the bank holiday weekend. He was standing within two metres of his friend.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Firms must pay some furlough costs from August
item.description: Rishi Sunak tonight announced that furloughed staff will be allowed to return to work on a part-time basis from July - a month earlier than originally planned.

item.title: Roger Federer tops Forbes' Athletes Rich List for the first time
item.description: Roger Federer is the first tennis player in the 30-year history of the list to take the top spot with the 38-year-old Swiss star taking the title after yearly earnings of $106.3million (£85.9m).

item.title: George Floyd death: THREE officers shown kneeling on him
item.description: The brief clips provide a different angle than the widely publicized video that was filmed on Memorial Day, with 3 officers seen on George Floyd's back.

item.title: NHS test and trace tsar Dido Harding is on board of Cheltenham Festival
item.description: Dido Harding sits on the board of the Jockey Club, the organisers of the horse racing event, which scientists called a 'disaster' for Britain and claimed accelerated the spread of coronavirus in the UK.

item.title: Elusive Dumbo octopus filmed in Java Trench 23,000 feet below the ocean surface
item.description: Researchers off the coast of Java have set a new record for the deepest encounter recorded with a 'dumbo' octopus at 23,000 below the ocean, breaking the previous record set in 1950.

item.title: Lockdown rules in England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland
item.description: Long-awaited changes are being made to the UK's coronavirus lockdown with the four Home Nations now adopting different approaches to the loosening of draconian rules.

item.title: IT issues mean Shielding scheme staff have reached just a handful of people in weeks, worker claims
item.description: A pledge was made in March to deliver packages of food and aid to 1.5million 'extremely vulnerable' people whose severe health conditions mean they couldn't leave their homes.

item.title: Furious social media users blast park-goers and al fresco drinkers for using bushes as toilets
item.description: Furious social media users have taken to Twitter to criticise park-goers and al fresco drinkers for using bushes as toilets across the country as lockdown starts to lift amid the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: RAF scrambled as pilot makes 600-mile 'beach trip' to Covid locked down Anglesey air field
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: His £4million aeroplane was surrounded by fire crews and military police as he touched down at RAF Valley in Anglesey on Bank Holiday Monday afternoon.

item.title: Historic England grants £25,000 to save King Henry VIII's Mary Rose
item.description: The money will allow employees to continue to work to monitor, maintain and repair the complex environmental system that preserves the 16th century Tudor battleship kept in Portsmouth.

item.title: UK's lockdown murder toll hits 100 with ten slayings in the past week
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Among the 100 victims were Kelly Fitzgibbons, 40, four-year-old Ava Needham and two-year-old Lexi Needham who died at a house in Woodmancote in West Sussex on March 29.

item.title: Cats will need to be gently weaned off human contact before the end of lockdown, RSPCA says
item.description: British charity the RSPCA says cats may have become more attached to their owners during the lockdown and will need to slowly be weaned off human contact as we exit lockdown,

item.title: Indian priest beheads man as a sacrifice to a goddess in order to end coronavirus
item.description: Sansari Ojha (left) killed Saroj Kumar Pradhan, 52, in Cuttack, India, on Wednesday night. The priest claimed he was following orders from a goddess to end the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Survey suggests Britain is becoming less scared about Covid-19
item.description: Data from the Office for National Statistics showed that 36 per cent of people said that they met friends or family from other households last week, which is now permitted under lockdown rules.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Death toll passes 38,000 with 324 new fatalities
item.description: Chancellor Rishi Sunak announced the figure tonight at Downing Street's daily press conference, where he also revealed 2,095 more Britons had been diagnosed with the virus.

item.title: Test and trace system 'could worsen Covid-19 problems in care homes'
item.description: Martin Green said there must be clear, separate rules set out for care homes in the UK as well as a regular, routine testing programme to help carers keep working if they aren't sick.

item.title: Facebook 'Venue' app acts as a 'second screen' for commentary and content about live events
item.description: The app, called Venue, which was created by Facebook's New Product Experimentation team, acts as a 'second screen' for when users are watching sports or other live-streamed events.

item.title: Dad-to-be shattered as hospital wins legal battle to turn off his pregnant partner's life support
item.description: Khayla Reno and her two daughters were involved in a fatal crash near Tumut in New South Wales' Riverina region after she reportedly veered into an oncoming truck.

item.title: Russian jets 'intercept' American bombers over the Black Sea
item.description: Video circulating online purports to show a Russian fighter plane approaching one of two US B1-B Lancer aircraft over the neutral waters of the Black Sea.

item.title: How coronavirus changed the BRAIN of a 25-year-old patient who lost her sense of smell
item.description: A radiographer in Italy started working with coronavirus patients, had a cough for one day, then lost her sense of smell. MRI scans of her brain showed how the virus inflamed olfactory regions.

item.title: Women who suffer the tragedy of stillbirth are four times more likely to develop Lupus in later life
item.description: Researchers from Manchester found a link between stillbirths and connective tissue disorders - with the association with Lupus being by far the strongest.

item.title: The £45 'it' dress you've probably never heard of!
item.description: Cornwall-based brand SeaSalt has found itself at the centre of bidding wars on eBay. A Mumsnet user revealed she had been outbid on the £45 Mill Pool dress on several occasions.

item.title: Are these the remains of Irish rebel 'Red' Hugh O'Donnell? Skeleton found in ruined Spanish chapel
item.description: More than a dozen intact remains have been discovered this week in digging at the Chapel of Wonders, where 'Red' Hugh O'Donnell was buried in 1602 after seeking refuge in Spain.

item.title: Duo overhaul LA castle before it was bought for $8.5million by Diane Kruger and Norman Reedus
item.description: Robert and Cortney Novogratz, who have starred in two reality TV shows about their designs, renovated the LA 1920s castle to a stunning modern mansion.

item.title: Newborn baby saved after it was found buried alive with just a foot poking out the ground in India
item.description: This is the miraculous moment a newborn baby buried alive in India is saved by villagers who spotted his foot poking out the ground.

item.title: Round Three! Boxer Amir Khan ignores Covid lockdown rules AGAIN for his daughter's sixth birthday
item.description: The boxer and wife Faryal Makhdoom held the surprise bash for Lamaisah at their home in Bolton and he could not resist posting a video of events to his 1.3 million Instagram followers.

item.title: Professor Green angers passengers by 'refusing' to wear a mask on flight from Amsterdam to London
item.description: Professor Green angered passengers on a flight from Amsterdam to London by refusing to wear a protective face mask.

item.title: Prince Harry praises young volunteers for Sports at Heart in London
item.description: Prince Harry, 35, spoke with young volunteers about delivering food packages to the vulnerable in London on a video call released by the charity Street Games on Twitter today.

item.title: How many people have died of Covid-19 in YOUR area?
item.description: North Somerset, Preston, Doncaster and Carlisle are enduring their worst weeks so far, according to data from the Office for National Statistics. The data reveals a considerable degree of variation on a local level.

item.title: Moscow revises its coronavirus death toll for April to 1,561 - more than DOUBLE the 636 fatalities
item.description: Moscow was criticised for its original figures and has since included 756 people who had coronavirus but died of other causes and 169 people suspected of having the virus but who tested negative.

item.title: Swansea driver, 91, who accidentally ran over and killed man at cashpoint is spared jail
item.description: Howell Hughes, 91, was behind the wheel of his Fiat Panda when it 'shot forward' and hit 66-year-old Brian Griffiths at a petrol station in Swansea, south Wales. He got a suspended sentence.

item.title: Pervert policeman is jailed for eight years for targeting girls, aged 13 and 15
item.description: A pervert policeman was jailed for eight years for grooming two schoolgirls for sex - and was caught after he was sacked from North Wales Police Force for stalking a female officer.

item.title: Fish eye lens: 'Single-pixel vision' allows zebrafish to spot their tiny prey
item.description: The fish see tiny objects through a single photoreceptor cell in the 'acute zone' of their eye, which is thought to be an early forerunner of the human fovea. It acts like a 'special pixel'.

item.title: North Korea declares 'sexual immorality' treason
item.description: North Korea's ruling party has ordered a crackdown after noticing that 'more and more high school boys and girls are engaging in immoral sexual deviance' (file photo, students dance in Pyongyang).

item.title: Aston Martin DB9 supercar worth £75,000 is destroyed after bursting into flames in horror crash
item.description: Emergency services rushed to the scene in Polegate, East Sussex, around 6.30pm last night. The driver suffered severe burns and his wife in the passenger seat sustained minor injuries.

item.title: Sydney sisters who took turns slapping an ex-boyfriend during a night out walk free from court
item.description: Irene Koukounaris, 25, and her sister Nansia Koukounaris, 23, faced Waverley Court for their 'slap attack' on Michael Ensor during a birthday party at Bondi Beach Public Bar.

item.title: How 'Zoom fatigue' can lead to burnout and depression
item.description: Named after the popular video chatting platform, Zoom fatigue is used to describe the exhaustion that comes with participating in video conferences.

item.title: Six Senses Zil Pasyon in the Seychelles has villas with clear-bottomed swimming pools IN THE CEILING
item.description: These spectacular 'ceiling pools' can be found in the three and four-bedroom residences at Six Senses Zil Pasyon on the stunning private island of Félicité in the Seychelles.

item.title: Girl, 2, fights for life after falling 40ft from bedroom window
item.description: The toddler, named locally as 'happy and sweet' Lara Coleman, had to be airlifted to hospital following the 'complete accident' on Bedford Street, Portsmouth, Hants, around 6pm last night.

item.title: Yob smashes 'Uber' driver's car window and kicks off the wing mirrors in furious attack
item.description: A shocking video shows a man, who is described as 'drunk and angry' attacking an 'Uber' driver's car in Hounslow, west London. He picks up a large object and smashes the rear window and kicks the car.

item.title: One in seven Brits admit to flouting lockdown rules to visit family, lovers or having haircut
item.description: One in seven Brits admit flouting lockdown rules in some capacity, it has been revealed. A survey carried out by the Sun indicates that a third of people have turned a blind eye to rules set by the government.

item.title: China to 'fully instruct' Hong Kong police on the crackdown on pro-democracy protests
item.description: The Chinese Ministry of Public Security said it would 'earnestly carry out' a newly passed national security law, which allows China to quell activities it deems as 'subversive' in the semi-autonomous city.

item.title: Coronavirus India: Monkeys take samples from college lab
item.description: The monkeys took three samples Meerut Medical College in Uttar Pradesh, India, today. Police say there is a risk of the infection spreading as the monkeys move around residential areas.

item.title: Black CNN reporter is arrested live on air by Minnesota state police
item.description: CNN correspondent Omar Jimenez was put in handcuffs and led away from his team of producers this morning shortly before 6.30am after the team was moved down the street by police in riot gear.

item.title: Jeffrey Epstein victim Maria Farmer bashes 'disgusting' new Netflix documentary
item.description: Maria Farmer, 50, appears in the four-part Netflix series on Jeffrey Epstein and tells DailyMail.com she thought it would be a 'good thing' and help give victims' claims credibility.

item.title: James Stunt's former bodyguard stole 16-carat yellow diamond worth £515,000 from tycoon, court hears
item.description: Justinas Ivaskivicius, 34, is accused of taking the gem from the Belgravia home of James Stunt (pictured), in Westminster, in December 2017. He will next appear at Southwark Crown Court on 26 June.

item.title: Dead 40ft whale washes up on beach in Essex as operation begins to remove body
item.description: The giant marine mammal, which has died, was swept to shore at Clacton-on-Sea on Friday. Essex Police said it is working with other organisations to plan how to remove it.

item.title: Mother, 55, reveals lockdown forced her to end her decade-long affair
item.description: Writing anonymously for the Daily Telegraph, the British mother-of-two, 55, explained she had been seeing the man, an ex-boyfriend from university who is married with two children, for 10 years.

item.title: Man jailed for four years over petrol station road rage attack
item.description: Aqeel Ahmed, 24, targeted his victim after a confrontation in the car park of a petrol station in Manchester on February 25.

item.title: PICTURED: Zookeeper, 35, who was cleaning a cage when she was 'viciously' attacked by two lion cubs
item.description: Big cat expert Ms Brown was pounced upon and savagely attacked in the neck and head as she cleaned a cage at the Shoalhaven Zoo in North Nowra on Friday morning.

item.title: This Morning viewers' photos of dogs before and after lockdown
item.description: This Morning viewers have shared hilarious pictures of their dogs before and after their long overdue haircuts, after dog grooming parlours across the UK began to re-open earlier this month.

item.title: TalkTalk and BT outage affects working from home across UK
item.description: The majority of reported issues are relating to internet connectivity. The outage was nationwide, with the most reports coming from Glasgow, Derby and Birmingham.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Test and Trace launches amid secrecy fears
item.description: People identified as having been in close contact with someone who has tested positive for coronavirus will not be told who has named them when they are asked to self-isolate for two weeks.

item.title: Pubs with gardens will be first hospitality businesses to reopen when lockdown is eased
item.description: Professor Robert Dingwall said a change in policy could allow four times as many people into a space as is currently allowed, signalling a huge boost for the hospitality industry.

item.title: Tatler's guide to holding a glamorous barbecue
item.description: British society bible Tatler has released its ultimate guide to holding a glamorous grill at home, including the perfect dress code, sporting entertainment and menu.

item.title: Meghan Markle has been secretly helping animal welfare charity during the coronavirus pandemic
item.description: Meghan Markle, 38, has been secretly working with the London-based animal welfare charity during the coronavirus pandemic, Mayhew's media officer Sarah Hastelow told Newsweek

item.title: Fury over study that halted global Covid-19 trials as letter questions its methods
item.description: More than 120 leading scientists and doctors from around the world, including four from the UK, have penned an open letter to the editor of the Lancet, the journal in which the study is published.

item.title: Former McDonald's worker reveals how she became a millionaire
item.description: Former McDonald's worker Chelsea Ferguson, 31, from Hartlepool, revealed how she launched subscription adult site AdmireMe.Vip two years ago, which has gone on to turn over £12 million.

item.title: Two-week quarantine for arrivals in the UK could be 'knocked on the head' by the end of June
item.description: A Government scheme which will force all travellers arriving in the UK to spend 14 days in quarantine could be scrapped just weeks after it is launched as a Tory revolt grows.

item.title: Ex-footballer gets excited about Premier League's return as he tots up number of games in a week
item.description: Solihull Moors forward Jake Beesley shared a video of his dad, ex-footballer Paul Beesley, counting how many matches he will be able to watch at their home in Dronfield, Derbyshire.

item.title: Glasses that can monitor your health and let you play video games with your eyes are developed
item.description: The groundbreaking new wearable tech built at Korea University, Seoul, can provide more advanced personal health data than devices like Fitbits or smart watches.

item.title: Ex-soldier, 41, is jailed after BITING policeman's arm in 'barbaric' attack
item.description: A drunken former soldier has been jailed for 12 months after biting a hero policeman on the arm in an attack that left the officer waiting months to find out if he had been left with HIV.

item.title: Woman, 94, living alone is rescued from starvation after not eating for five days
item.description: The desperately hungry pensioner had holed up alone in her top-floor tenement flat in Govan, Glasgow, where she remained rooted for fear of catching coronavirus.

item.title: Emily Maitlis' Left-leaning views are exposed in tweets and retweets to her 360,000 followers
item.description: Miss Maitlis caused a stir on Tuesday with her comments on Dominic Cummings' trip to Durham during lockdown.

item.title: Mother appeals to find 15-year-old daughter's rapist
item.description: The mother of a 15-year-old school girl who was raped on her way home from school in Streatham, south London in September 2019 said the attack has destroyed her daughter's confidence.

item.title: DOUGLAS MURRAY: It's not the first time Emily Maitlis has forced her bosses to apologise for her
item.description: DOUGLAS MURRAY: Newsnight presenter, Emily Maitlis (pictured), was visibly angered by Boris Johnson's colleagues describing him as a 'fighter'.

item.title: Millions of locusts swarm Indian city as country is rocked by heatwave and coronavirus
item.description: Photographs taken this week in Jaipur, one of 33 Rajasthan districts affected, show millions of locusts ravaging fields and covering walls as swarms continue to destroy harvests.

item.title: Russia plans to build its own space station when the ISS reaches the end of its life
item.description: Roscosmos plans to take the modules it built for the ISS and use them as the base parts of its new orbiting space station - which will take a decade to build.

item.title: Challenging quiz puts your Greek mythology knowledge to the test
item.description: The tricky set of 17 questions about Greek gods and goddesses was put together by Terry Stein on the US-based trivia site Playbuzz, and is sure to get even the most alpha quizzers thinking.

item.title: Hundreds arrested as police target 'county lines' drugs gangs
item.description: More than 100 weapons were found, including firearms, while 139 'deal lines' - linked to unique numbers dialled by users to buy drugs - were shut down in the UK between last November and March.
item.media:description: Illegal items seized during a crackdown on county lines gangs (West Midlands Police/PA)

item.title: PAUL THOMAS on... test and trace in the UK
item.description: 'When 2,456,000 people say they have Covid and were in contact with you, we can't take any chances, Mr Cummings'

item.title: Missile markings on Air Force jets suggest they bombed ISIS founder Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi's compound
item.description: US Air Force F-15E Strike Eagle warplanes stopped off at RAF Lakenheath in Suffolk on Wednesday after flying missions over Syria and Iraq. The planes were likely involved in raid on Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi.

item.title: Coral-coated shipwreck found off the coast of Mexico crashed into the 'Nightmare reef' 200 years ago
item.description: A coral-coated shipwreck has been found off the coast of Mexico that has laid hidden beneath the surface for over 200 years. Researchers believe it is a British ship that crashed into ' Nightmare reef .'

item.title: UK Weather: Driest May ever set to continue with 82F weekend
item.description: Parts of the UK are on track for the driest May yet, with temperatures set to hit 82F (28C) in isolated UK spots today, leaving Jumbles Reservoir in Bolton (pictured) on the verge of totally drying up.

item.title: Dara McAnulty has the rare gift of evoking the natural world
item.description: Dara McAnulty, 17, from Northern Ireland, who is best known for running a popular blog about his adventures, has penned his first book, Diary Of A Young Naturalist.

item.title: Friends, flowers and foolproof pastry
item.description: British garden designer Jo Thompson and cook Mary Jane Paterson have penned a new book offering their expert cooking and gardening advice.
